unnormalised: Transfer windows, typically occurring in pre-season and mid-season, provide specific periods for these transactions. The pressure is immense, both for teams seeking improvements and players aiming for better opportunities. A star player transferring for Rs. 5 Crore could be considered a bargain, while another going for Rs. 20 Crore could be deemed an overpayment. It all depends on performance!

unnormalised: Factors influencing a transfer include player form, contract length, team needs, and of course, the size of the transfer fee and salary package. The impact of a key transfer can be immediate, dramatically shifting a team's fortunes, or it can take time for the player to integrate. Just like how it takes time to fully appreciate the subtle flavors of an Onam sadhya. Ultimately, successful transfers require shrewd scouting, effective negotiation, and a bit of luck. This applies to Kabaddi leagues and Cricket. A poorly judged transfer can cost a team their championship ambitions and millions of Rs.
